Posts.Content: Best bird, The number that really stood out is the 93.7%. I just switched to a PARP inhibitor which also has a fairly high response rate but not near the 90% threshold. As always, thanks much for the info! - m
Posts.Title: New Promising Experimental Drug

Posts.Content: Thank you for sharing. I am so sorry for your loss. Wishing you peace. - m
Posts.Title: In Memoriam, "New Challenges"

Posts.Content: Well, I went with a wig when I lost my hair. I didn’t want the “looks” and my hair fell out unevenly so I lookied like something out of a horror movie. I have had “regular” normal times during the past five years as well as “new” normal. I have been able to drive from Seattle to Arizona and back the past two years, things like this help. Oh, as far as wine goes, all for it, whatever makes this a little easier. - m
Posts.Title: The clerk called me "Sir" and my visit to Memorial Sloan Kettering.

Posts.Content: Fightarm, Thank you for posting info from all of your research. It certainly sounds as though there are many entities out there attempting to fight cancer in new ways and not just with chemo. -m
Posts.Title: CD47 clinical trials for many cancers.

Posts.Content: As always, thanks for this information. Really great to hear about the trial. - m
Posts.Title: New cancer breakthroughs

Posts.Content: Very sorry to hear about this. I know one of our inspire members here had a port put in the back of her head for chemo. She was HER2 pos and the HER 2 drugs cross the blood brain barrier. Wishing you and your daughter the best. - m
Posts.Title: Turn for the worse

Posts.Content: Hey there, So my first year I ate really healthy and drank really good for you juices but as time went on, I have regressed to sometimes eating healthy and other times: pizza. As far as exercise,I do not have a strict regimen but I do walk at least 6 miles a day. I also do acupuncture regularly. - m
Posts.Title: Question for MBC 5+ years

Posts.Content: I had coughing and a scratchy throat for a bit on other meds, but it did go away. Made me nervous though.
Posts.Title: Coughing

Posts.Content: Please keep posting the MBC site. I am a fan. I believe people,do better when they are better informed. -m
Posts.Title: PD1/PD-L1 is the superstar checkpoint

Posts.Content: Thanks for the PARP info, I took a look at the web site and there are A LOT of trials out there,
Posts.Title: ASCO 2019 MBC Information

Posts.Content: My markers are generally reliable but this is not the case for many. Also, there is a delay in my markers. After progression, they rise and same with going down. It’s kind of like watching a sporting event on a five second delay. Happy to say that they are down quite a bit on the new drug.
Posts.Title: I'd Rather Bet on The Stock Market Than My Tumor Markers

Posts.Content: Anne, Thank you for the comprehensive review. There are some promising studies out there. Just curious, any news on PARP inhibitors? Since I am currently on one, I thought I’d ask. Thanks,
Posts.Title: ASCO 2019 MBC Information

Posts.Content: Fight arm, thanks for what in your research in an understandable way. -m
Posts.Title: PD1/PD-L1 is the superstar checkpoint
